description.narrative: For human rights training, radio programs, human rights clubs for children. Violence against children is a serious problem in Uganda and occurs at home, at school, at work, and in the context at child trafficking and child prostitution. The actual number of cases is expected to exceed reported cases. Corporal punishment is a serious problem where 81% of school pupils in 2011 were subjected to physical punishments. A significant proportion of victims of violence are girls who, in particular, experience sexual violence. Economic and social barriers make access to justice difficult. Child prostitution has increased from 2004 to 2011 and poverty increases child labor, which in turn increases the chances of becoming a victim of violence. The project aims to increase community awareness of children's rights, the related laws and obligations, and to improve community participation in the protection of the rights of children and the promotion of access to justice. The aim is to strengthen local mechanisms for the promotion of children's rights in the target communities and schools
